intro: Onosma ampliata, commonly known as the broad-leaved onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
